mentions.context: Using BitterX software (Huang et al., 2016), it was found that these eight peptides were highly likely to activate bitter receptors (either TA2R7 or T2R40; probability: 88-79%).

Peptide identification was performed with X!Tandem v. 2017.2.14 (Alanine) and X!Tandem Pipeline (C++) v. 0.2.40 (Langella et al., 2017) using protein sequences for Pisum sativum L. The main peptide identification parameters were the following: no cleavage specificity, variable methionine oxidation state, and mass tolerance for parent and fragment ions of ±10 ppm.

Peptide identification was performed with X!Tandem v. 2017.2.14 (Alanine) and X!Tandem Pipeline (C++) v. 0.2.40 (Langella et al., 2017) using protein sequences for Pisum sativum L. The main peptide identification parameters were the following: no cleavage specificity, variable methionine oxidation state, and mass tolerance for parent and fragment ions of ±10 ppm.
As in Proust et al. (2019), these properties were computed using the aminoAcidProperties function of the R package "alakazam" v. 0.2.8 (Gupta et al., 2015).
To visualize the intersections in the peptide sets among the six fractions and the two raw solutions, the function "upset" in the package UpSetR was used (Conway et al., 2017).
